### Best Routes from JFK Airport to Times Square Traveling from John F. Kennedy International Airport (JFK) to Times Square in Manhattan offers several convenient options depending on your budget, time, and comfort preferences. Below are the most popular and efficient routes: #### 1. **AirTrain + Subway (Most Cost-Effective)** - **Step 1**: Take the **AirTrain JFK** from your terminal to **Jamaica Station** (cost: $8.25). - **Step 2**: Transfer to the **E, J, or Z subway line**. - If taking the E train, ride it to **50th Streetâ€“8th Avenue**. - If taking the J/Z, go to **Broadway Junction**, transfer to the **A/C** toward Manhattan, then transfer again at **59th Streetâ€“Columbus Circle** to the **N/Q/R/W** or walk to Times Square (~10 min). - **Step 3**: Walk from the subway station to Times Square (about 5â€“10 minutes). - **Total Time**: ~60â€“75 minutes - **Cost**: ~$11.25 (includes AirTrain + MetroCard) ğŸ”— [MTA Trip Planner](https://new.mta.info/trip-planner) #### 2. **AirTrain + Long Island Rail Road (LIRR) + Subway (Faster Option)** - **Step 1**: Take **AirTrain JFK** to **Jamaica Station**. - **Step 2**: Board the **LIRR** (to Penn Station, Manhattan). This trip takes about 15â€“20 minutes. - **Step 3**: From **Penn Station**, walk north to Times Square (about 10 minutes) or take the **1, 2, 3, A, C, or E** subway one stop. - **Total Time**: ~45 minutes - **Cost**: ~$10.75 off-peak (LIRR + MetroCard combo fare); higher during peak hours. This option is ideal for rush-hour travelers seeking speed and comfort. ğŸ”— [LIRR from JFK Info](https://new.mta.info/airports/jfk) #### 3. **Taxi or Rideshare (Most Convenient)** - **Yellow Cab**: Official NYC taxis charge a flat fare of **$70** (plus tolls and tip) from JFK to Manhattan. - **Rideshare (Uber/Lyft)**: Prices vary by demand; typically **$75â€“$100**, sometimes more during peak times. - **Drop-off**: Request drop-off at **Times Square (Broadway & 42nd St)**. - **Total Time**: ~30â€“50 minutes (depending on traffic) - **Best For**: Travelers with luggage or in groups. #### 4. **Shared or Private Airport Shuttle** - Companies like **NYC Airporter**, **SuperShuttle**, or **GoAir** offer shared rides. - **Cost**: $15â€“$25 per person. - **Drop-off**: Multiple stops in Midtown; may take longer than private options. - **Booking Required**: Some services require advance reservation. ğŸ”— [NYC Airporter Bus](https://www.airporter.com/) --- ### Summary Comparison | Option | Time | Cost | Comfort | |-------|------|------|---------| | AirTrain + Subway | 60â€“75 min | ~$11 | Moderate | | AirTrain + LIRR + Subway | ~45 min | ~$11â€“$15 | High | | Taxi / Rideshare | 30â€“50 min | $70â€“$100 | High | | Shared Shuttle | 60+ min | $15â€“$25 | Lowâ€“Moderate | Choose based on your priorities: cost savings, speed, or convenience.

OpenAI has recently launched AgentKit, a new toolkit designed to help developers build, deploy, and optimize AI agents more easily. This announcement was made during OpenAI's DevDay 2025 event. AgentKit includes several key components:

  • Agent Builder: A visual tool that allows developers to design agent logic quickly, similar to using Canva for design.
  • ChatKit: Enables developers to embed customizable chat interfaces into their applications.
  • Evals for Agents: Provides tools to measure agent performance, including step-by-step trace grading and automated prompt optimization.
  • Connector Registry: Allows secure integration of agents with internal tools and third-party systems through an admin control panel.

AgentKit is built on top of the Responses API and aims to streamline the process of taking AI agents from prototype to production. It is now available to all users.

The OpenAI Agent SDK refers to the software development kit that enables developers to create and manage AI agents within the OpenAI ecosystem. While the term "Agent SDK" isn't explicitly defined in the provided results, it likely encompasses the core tools and APIs used to develop agents, such as those included in AgentKit.

Compared to other workflow tools, OpenAI's AgentKit stands out by offering a comprehensive suite of tools specifically tailored for building autonomous AI agents. Unlike traditional workflows that may require manual scripting or integration, AgentKit provides a unified platform with features like visual agent design, performance evaluation, and secure connectivityâ€”all aimed at simplifying the development process.

To travel from Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA) to hotels near the Petronas Twin Towers using public transit, follow these steps:

  1. Take the KLIA Express or ERL (Express Rail Link) train from KLIA to KL Sentral station. This journey takes approximately 30-40 minutes and costs around RM 55 for a one-way ticket.
  2. At KL Sentral, transfer to the MRT (Mass Rapid Transit) system. Take the MRT Putrajaya Line (also known as the Kajang Line) towards Kajang direction.
  3. Alight at the KLCC Station (Kuala Lumpur Convention Centre), which is directly connected to the Petronas Twin Towers via an air-conditioned walkway.
  4. From KLCC Station, you can walk to nearby hotels such as The Petronas Tower area hotels like The Pavilion Hotel or Petronas Twin Towers Hotel.

Alternative Option: You can also take a bus from KLIA to Bukit Bintang (e.g., Bus 150, 173, 250, 590, or 600), then transfer to the Monorail or LRT to reach KLCC. However, this route may be less convenient due to traffic and multiple transfers.

Additional Tips:

  • Use the Rapid KL transit map to plan your journey.
  • The KLIA Transit website provides detailed information on fares and schedules.
  • Consider purchasing a Touch 'n Go card for seamless travel across public transport systems.

- **OpenAI** is advancing its **o3** and **o4** reasoning models, focusing on improved planning, tool use, and problem-solving capabilities. - **Microsoft** and **NVIDIA** have deepened their AI partnership, co-developing next-gen AI chips and cloud infrastructure to support large-scale AI training. - **xAI**, Elon Muskâ€™s AI company, continues training **Grok-3** on real-time data from X (formerly Twitter), aiming to create a more dynamic and context-aware AI assistant. Grok is being tested for advanced reasoning and multi-modal capabilities. [Updates via X](https://x.com/xai)

- **Meta AI** unveiled **Llama 3.1**, a fully open-source large language model with enhanced multilingual support and reasoning abilities. It is now one of the most widely adopted models in the open-source AI community. [Meta AI Blog](https://ai.meta.com/llama/)
